text: Allow yourself to act akin to water, flowing freely down the easiest path.
What seems to be the simplest road can sometimes be the most winding.
One must be ready to change their plans at a moment's notice.
Meticulous attention to detail takes both time and effort, but none can argue with the results.
With both firm conviction and careful foresight, you can direct the world like puppets.
[[b]]Firmness[[/b]] can be increased by armies on field, assignments, and battles won.
[[b]]Firmness[[/b]] can be decreased by battles lost, assignments, governors, military access, and non-aggression pacts.
A flexible strategy goes hand in hand with a firm conviction.
• Increases effectiveness of armies and spies' networks
• Reduces diplomatic relations and increases army upkeep
• Armies boost Firmness while providing replenishment in foreign land
• Governors reduce upkeep of armies while consuming Firmness
• Military Access & Non-aggression pacts reduce Firmness
A flexible strategy goes hand in hand with a firm conviction.
A flexible strategy goes hand in hand with a firm conviction.
Display foresight by allocating an advisor to secure army surpluses and provisions for future endeavours.
By changing plans, your aide can reallocate materiel to the frontline.
Negotiate a mutual non-aggression pact with this faction, agreeing that you will not declare war on one another.
We will sign a non-aggression pact with {#recipientsfaction#}
We will sign a non-aggression pact with {#proposersfaction#}
We have a pact of non-aggression with {#recipientsfaction#}
We have a pact of non-aggression with {#proposersfaction#}
Negotiate a mutual military access agreement, allowing your forces to march across each other's lands.
We will allow military access between our factions
We will allow military access between our factions
We have a military access agreement with {#recipientsfaction#}
We have a military access agreement with {#proposersfaction#}
